reporting-org.narrative: Arab Foundation for Freedoms and Equality

title.narrative: Building Power and Resilience: Working towards the inclusion and empowerment of marginalised groups in Lebanon

description.narrative: The Arab Foundation for Freedom and Equality, along with its partners, have employed their capacities and different connections to the community and its surrounding allies to build power and facilitate access to information to counter and reduce the harm being propagated against queer lives and bodies in Lebanon. Through different activities, the outputs of the project can be stated as: Creating a positive shift in public perception of marginalised groups in Lebanon, Building stronger resilience in Lebanese community for marginalised groups, and addressing the Sexual and Mental Health needs among marginalised groups in the Lebanese community.

participating-org.narrative: Arab Foundation for Freedoms and Equality

organisation.narrative: Arab Foundation for Freedoms and Equality

title.narrative: The Lebanese public and/or "Marginalised" community takes advantage of annual opportunity to raise awareness about contemporary challenges and increase knowledge around different issues

description.narrative: An impact-full video which addresses the contemporary challenges facing the community and is tailored towards public awareness that encapsulates the theme of the years "important dates", will be produced in an attempt to raise the voice on the challenges facing the community and to increase the knowledge around different issues facing the community.

title.narrative: The number of videos produced accumulating the 50,000 views and high level of engagement

comment.narrative: A public awareness and community building campaign for IDAHOBIT 2020 tackling the challenge of online hate speech against marginalised people in Lebanon, and highlighting some of the most damaging attacks against the community in 2020 and refusing the misconceptions propagated by the Lebanese community. The video received 155K number of views, 1.8K number of interactions, and 399 number of comments, and 276 number of shares on Facebook as well as 19K number of views and 1,591 number of interactions on Instagram making it one of the most successful themed video in terms of interactions

title.narrative: Lebanese citizens and passersby are educated and exposed to marginalised groups narratives in a person-to-person engagement

description.narrative: In our bid to increase exposure of marginalised people and educate people on the experience of the marginalised people, we aim to launch the “Red Box”. The “Red Box” red box contains hundreds of handwritten letters by members of marginalised community. The “Red Box” invites passers to take and read a letter while a crew filmed their reactions from a distance and occasionally interviewed individuals who were open to speak on camera. The nonviolent but nevertheless confrontational approach that the letters provide to the reader create spaces for dialogue between the community and the public at large.

title.narrative: Increased education for individuals who pick up letters in various Lebanese locales

description.narrative: The “Red Box” red box contains hundreds of handwritten letters by members of marginalised community. The “Red Box” invites passers to take and read a letter while a crew filmed their reactions from a distance and occasionally interviewed individuals who were open to speak on camera. The nonviolent but nevertheless confrontational approach that the letters provide to the reader create spaces for dialogue between the community and the public at large. In such way, people are more educated and are exposed to the experience of the marginalised groups.

target.value: 1000 letters taken out of 1500 printed in the least

comment.narrative: The physical material for the Red Box campaign have already been designed and ready for printing. We have identified 30 individuals from the community and are writing the letters. We have also started online meetings with the video production crew for this campaign.

title.narrative: Increased "Marginalised Groups" content on local media channels using acquired capacities

description.narrative: In our bid to increase the visibility of the marginalised groups and their image in media, AFE is working on establishing media partnerships with 2 media outlets throughout the year of 2020 and 2021, one in each year. AFE will work with media outlets and provide them with SOGIE manual on means to write and disseminate different material in accordance with SOGIE guidelines.

title.narrative: Number of partnerships with media partnerships

comment.narrative: We are in contact with different media outlets to establish a partnership. We will commit to this partnership once the lock down is over. Once the MoU is signed, AFE will commit to support the organisation, by providing it with SOGIE manual and training on how to report in accordance with the SOGIE standards.

title.narrative: Participating students are empowered with increased knowledge and skills to stay safe, healthy, and advocate on behalf and for others.

description.narrative: In our bid to make sure young Lebanese students are equipped with the knowledge and skill-set to counter harmful arguments and assert their power and share of the debate around gender and sexuality both inside and outside campus. We have identified 8 universities in Lebanon with sizeable and visible marginalised groups and allies within functioning clubs to empower with information and tactics.

title.narrative: Knowledge and skill of each participant is increased in the fields of rights, defense, knowledge, argumentation and intervention

description.narrative: We made preliminary meetings with all presidents of the gender and sexuality clubs of 4 different universities for the youth outreach program, numbering more than 250+ individuals, and is currently negotiating a schedule for the training to take place. Moreover, we have been working on all of the training presentations and material whilst identifying 50% of the target population of participants for the workshops. Moreover, we have conducted the training of trainers for the individuals giving the training. In the second quarter of the year, we have finalised all the presentations and agendas of the workshops as well as finalising all the manuals for participants. We plan on scheduling the workshops starting September 01, 2020. We have included a short introduction on how to stay safe during the COVID-19 pandemic.

target.value: 300 students trained showing 25% increase in knowledge

comment.narrative: This target represents the number of youth we are targeting over the course of 1 year. We will be reporting on the number of participants in the training quarterly.

The COVID-19 outbreak has forced us to take different measures and procedures when tacking the training sessions. WE have already held meeting with the gender and sexuality clubs at 4 different universities and identified the participants and prepared the material for the training. As part of COVID-19 regulations imposed by the Government, Universities was stopped, thus forcing students to attend online classes and all physical gathering has been banned. We are thinking of different ways on how to conduct those workshops starting September 01.

title.narrative: Marginalised groups living outside the capital are mapped and their needs have been assessed

description.narrative: In our bid to to map and assess the need of marginalised groups living outside the capital, we are working to identify and integrate marginalised communities in the less serviced areas of the North, South and Bekaa regions of Lebanon. This will be done over 2 phases, each for one year. Year 1 will include the research phase through which focal points and 90 individuals, for all three districts, will be sampled for a semi-structured questionnaire designed to gather information and provide recommendations for all service providers in a manner that will address the needs that are raised during the process.

title.narrative: Increased ability to service marginalized groups living outside the capital through informed interventions

description.narrative: Following the collection phase, data will be analysed. Once the data is analysed, conclusions will be drawn and used a base to produce a sensitisation video for service providers working in the focus localities to use and distribute, aiming to increase awareness. The second phase will include a community mobilisation initiative for the marginalised community members from the targeted area

target.value: 1 mapping and needs assessment report in the first year and 1 one action plan developed to be implemented in the second year

comment.narrative: Data collection methodology has been discussed and will include focus group discussions (of 8-12 individuals each) in three main areas outside of Beirut (the north, south, and bekaa regions of Lebanon). Moreover, we reviewed possible questions to include in the data collection survey later on in the project. This will cut down the work load for later once outreach officers have been recruited. The outreach officers will be local individuals recruited from each of the designated areas, they will recruit individuals from marginalised individuals’ hot-spots in the areas in order to participate in the focus group discussions. Outreach officers must me trustworthy and known by the community in order to facilitate the smooth collection of data and must have a good command of the Arabic language. They will also help devise the discussion guide and will be trained accordingly. A training session will be given to the outreach officers prior to data collection in order to ensure proper facilitation and documentation. Also, a focus group discussion guide will be developed and tested.

title.narrative: Accessible STI testing services and sexual health information are available for marginalised groups in Lebanon.

description.narrative: In providing better access to testing services and sexual health information, we aim to provide marginalised groups with voluntary counselling and testing services, medical consultations, and Psycho-social counselling support. We will provide the numbers of each of those services in the comments sections in the Indicator Section.

title.narrative: Increased access to quality and non-discriminatory sexual health services, including rapid testing, medical consultations and psycho-social counselling, for marginalised groups in Lebanon.

description.narrative: We have been able to supply marginalised groups with quality and non-discriminatory sexual health services including rapid testing, medical consultations and psycho-social counselling, for marginalised groups in Lebanon. The baseline and targets indicated below are based on a yearly unit. We will be reporting on each quarter, while mentioning the number of each service in the comments section in the indicator section.

comment.narrative: We aim at providing 1950 service for marginalised groups in the first year of the project, and another 1950 service in the second year of the project 2021. As mentioned in the target section, the 1950 services are our target from January 2020 till December 2020. We will report in each quarter on its own, thus the value in the"actual" section below represents the number of services provided during the first two quarters in 2020.

After the COVID-19 pandemic, certain measures were taken in Lebanon, pushing us to take certain measures as well in providing the services. Due to government regulations following the outbreak, we continued to provide quality services while adapting to the measures. In March, we continued to support the marginalised community amid the procedures of the government and our safety protocols. We have been able to provide those services, answering inquiries and referral via the hotline, email, social media, and provision of services for urgent cases only. We have provided 462 services in the first quarter of 2020 and 262 services in the second quarter of 2020 including voluntary counselling and rapid testing, medical consultations and psycho-social counselling, for marginalised groups in Lebanon. The number of voluntary counselling and testing services stands at 434, while that of Medical Consultations provided stands at 104, and psycho-social support stands at 186. This in addition to providing counselling through the hotline due to Government regulations in April, which stands at 29.

description.narrative: in our bid to make access to STI testing services and sexual health information available for marginalised groups in Lebanon, we are working to provide increased access to condoms.

comment.narrative: We aim at distributing 3000 condoms in the first year of the project, and another 3000 in the second year of the project 2021. As mentioned in the target section, the 3000 condoms are our target from January 2020 till December 2020. We will report in each quarter on its own, thus the value in the"actual" section below represents the number of condoms distributed during the first quarter of 2020.

The number of condoms distributed (890) is over the course of the first quarter. 350 condoms were distributed at an underground drag show event, while 540 condoms were distributed during Valentine's day weekend. We are re-planning on the base of this activity to find the optimal way to resume the distribution, as different gatherings were prohibited and access to University students was minimal, as universities stopped

title.narrative: Increase in familial acceptance of marginalised individuals

description.narrative: We seek to facilitate the acceptance of marginalised individuals by their families. Part of that lies, in connecting mothers of marginalised individuals whom we already know are supportive (5 moms some of which are part of an upcoming video campaign to introduce parents to the marginalised groups rights debate in Lebanon and to announce the service) so mothers and fathers with questions about their children or in need of support can find it in the closed parent meetings instead of resorting to individuals/organisations showing hostility to marginalised groups rights. A vetted psychologist will be attending each of the meetings and a manual will be produced to assist additional parents moving forward answering all major questions and offering support for parents in doubt and pain.

title.narrative: Increase in positive attitudes amongst participants

description.narrative: We aim to hold meetings between parents to discuss questions about their children. A vetted psychologist will be attending each of the meetings.

target.value: 420 participants benefited from the family support meetings

comment.narrative: The target is over the course of the whole project.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we were forced to take specific measures as part of the whole safety plan. As such, the meetings did not start yet. In our bid to start the whole program, we set up the Family Support calendar and identified the psychologist to be working with families and youth, initial youth participants, and finished preparing for the upcoming video campaign to introduce parents to the marginalised groups rights. We contacted the video production company and finalised the script and cast for the family outreach programs inaugural video, in addition to identifying the youth participants for the family support program. We are aiming at conducting 2 sessions per month starting September adding up to 8 sessions in 2020, whilst continuing the sessions in 2021. We will be taking all safety and health measures to ensure everyone’s security, safety and health wellbeing.
